data.taskTitle: Persist sound effects preference across sessions
Persist sound effects preference across sessions
data.approach: Make UserProfile.svelte use the preferences store getSoundsEnabled reactively via $derived instead of maintaining a local copy that desynchronizes

summary: Changed soundsEnabled from local state to derived reactive value from preferences store
Removed unnecessary onMount and areSoundsEnabled import
Sound preference now properly persists across sessions
reviewFocus: Confirm preference persists after page reload

summary: Changed soundsEnabled to $derived reactive value from preferences store
Sound preference now persists correctly across sessions

data.taskTitle: Debug: Task completed in timeline but open in Beads
Debug: Task completed in timeline but open in Beads
data.approach: Will investigate the sound effects task that shows completed in timeline but open in Beads. Check timeline JSONL, Beads database, and complete.md process to find the disconnect.

data.taskTitle: Debug: Task completed in timeline but open in Beads
summary: Identified root cause: Agent emitted completed signal without running bd close
Timeline shows completed signal at 11:17:01Z but no completing (closing) step
This is a workflow compliance issue, not a tooling bug
The /jat:complete command was not fully executed
data.approach: Traced timeline events, compared to Beads state, analyzed completion workflow documentation
reviewFocus: Consider adding validation to prevent this in future

data.taskTitle: Debug: Task completed in timeline but open in Beads
Debug: Task completed in timeline but open in Beads
Debug: Task completed in timeline but open in Beads
Debug: Task completed in timeline but open in Beads

summary: Identified root cause: Agent emitted completed signal without running bd close
Traced HighCanyon timeline showing completed signal at 11:17:01Z with no bd close
Confirmed this was a workflow compliance issue, not a tooling bug
The /jat:complete command was not fully executed by the agent

suggestedTasks.title: Add validation to jat-signal for completed signal
suggestedTasks.description: When agent emits jat-signal completed, check if task is still open in Beads and warn or block. This would prevent the workflow compliance issue where agents emit completed signal without running bd close.
suggestedTasks.reason: Would have caught this issue automatically

suggestedTasks.title: Add completing signal requirement before completed
suggestedTasks.description: Require that completing signals (verifying, committing, closing, etc.) are emitted before the completed signal. This would catch cases where agents skip the full /jat:complete workflow.

patterns: Always run bd close BEFORE emitting completed signal
The /jat:complete workflow has a specific order: verify → commit → close → release → announce → signal
gotchas: Emitting completed signal does NOT close the task in Beads - you must run bd close first
The dashboard timeline shows completed but Beads can still show open if bd close was skipped
